speaker: First Gaoler
text_entry: SCENE V. Cymbeline's tent.

speaker: First Gaoler
text_entry: Enter CYMBELINE, BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS, ARVIRAGUS, PISANIO, Lords, Officers, and Attendants

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Stand by my side, you whom the gods have made

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Preservers of my throne. Woe is my heart

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That the poor soldier that so richly fought,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Whose rags shamed gilded arms, whose naked breast

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Stepp'd before larges of proof, cannot be found:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: He shall be happy that can find him, if

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Our grace can make him so.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I never saw

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Such noble fury in so poor a thing;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Such precious deeds in one that promises nought

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: But beggary and poor looks.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: No tidings of him?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: He hath been search'd among the dead and living,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: But no trace of him.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To my grief, I am

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The heir of his reward;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS, and ARVIRAGUS

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: which I will add

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To you, the liver, heart and brain of Britain,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: By whom I grant she lives. 'Tis now the time

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To ask of whence you are. Report it.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: In Cambria are we born, and gentlemen:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Further to boast were neither true nor modest,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Unless I add, we are honest.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Bow your knees.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Arise my knights o' the battle: I create you

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Companions to our person and will fit you

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: With dignities becoming your estates.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Enter CORNELIUS and Ladies

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: There's business in these faces. Why so sadly

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Greet you our victory? you look like Romans,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And not o' the court of Britain.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Hail, great king!

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: To sour your happiness, I must report

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: The queen is dead.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Who worse than a physician

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Would this report become? But I consider,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: By medicine life may be prolong'd, yet death

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Will seize the doctor too. How ended she?

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: With horror, madly dying, like her life,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Which, being cruel to the world, concluded

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Most cruel to herself. What she confess'd

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: I will report, so please you: these her women

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Can trip me, if I err; who with wet cheeks

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Were present when she finish'd.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Prithee, say.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: First, she confess'd she never loved you, only

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Affected greatness got by you, not you:

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Married your royalty, was wife to your place;

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Abhorr'd your person.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: She alone knew this;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And, but she spoke it dying, I would not

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Believe her lips in opening it. Proceed.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Your daughter, whom she bore in hand to love

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: With such integrity, she did confess

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Was as a scorpion to her sight; whose life,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: But that her flight prevented it, she had

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Ta'en off by poison.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: O most delicate fiend!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Who is 't can read a woman? Is there more?

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: More, sir, and worse. She did confess she had

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: For you a mortal mineral; which, being took,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Should by the minute feed on life and lingering

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: By inches waste you: in which time she purposed,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: By watching, weeping, tendance, kissing, to

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: O'ercome you with her show, and in time,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: When she had fitted you with her craft, to work

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Her son into the adoption of the crown:

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: But, failing of her end by his strange absence,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Grew shameless-desperate; open'd, in despite

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Of heaven and men, her purposes; repented

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: The evils she hatch'd were not effected; so

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Despairing died.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Heard you all this, her women?

speaker: First Lady
text_entry: We did, so please your highness.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Mine eyes

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Were not in fault, for she was beautiful;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Mine ears, that heard her flattery; nor my heart,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That thought her like her seeming; it had

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: been vicious

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To have mistrusted her: yet, O my daughter!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That it was folly in me, thou mayst say,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And prove it in thy feeling. Heaven mend all!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Enter LUCIUS, IACHIMO, the Soothsayer, and other  Roman Prisoners, guarded; POSTHUMUS LEONATUS behind, and IMOGEN

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou comest not, Caius, now for tribute that

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The Britons have razed out, though with the loss

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Of many a bold one; whose kinsmen have made suit

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That their good souls may be appeased with slaughter

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Of you their captives, which ourself have granted:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: So think of your estate.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Consider, sir, the chance of war: the day

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Was yours by accident; had it gone with us,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: We should not, when the blood was cool,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: have threaten'd

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Our prisoners with the sword. But since the gods

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Will have it thus, that nothing but our lives

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: May be call'd ransom, let it come: sufficeth

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: A Roman with a Roman's heart can suffer:

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Augustus lives to think on't: and so much

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: For my peculiar care. This one thing only

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: I will entreat; my boy, a Briton born,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Let him be ransom'd: never master had

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: A page so kind, so duteous, diligent,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: So tender over his occasions, true,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: So feat, so nurse-like: let his virtue join

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: With my request, which I make bold your highness

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Cannot deny; he hath done no Briton harm,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Though he have served a Roman: save him, sir,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: And spare no blood beside.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I have surely seen him:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: His favour is familiar to me. Boy,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou hast look'd thyself into my grace,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And art mine own. I know not why, wherefore,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To say 'live, boy:' ne'er thank thy master; live:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And ask of Cymbeline what boon thou wilt,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Fitting my bounty and thy state, I'll give it;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Yea, though thou do demand a prisoner,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The noblest ta'en.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I humbly thank your highness.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: I do not bid thee beg my life, good lad;

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: And yet I know thou wilt.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: No, no: alack,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: There's other work in hand: I see a thing

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Bitter to me as death: your life, good master,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Must shuffle for itself.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: The boy disdains me,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: He leaves me, scorns me: briefly die their joys

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: That place them on the truth of girls and boys.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Why stands he so perplex'd?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: What wouldst thou, boy?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I love thee more and more: think more and more

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: What's best to ask. Know'st him thou look'st on? speak,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Wilt have him live? Is he thy kin? thy friend?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: He is a Roman; no more kin to me

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Than I to your highness; who, being born your vassal,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Am something nearer.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Wherefore eyest him so?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I'll tell you, sir, in private, if you please

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To give me hearing.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Ay, with all my heart,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And lend my best attention. What's thy name?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Fidele, sir.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou'rt my good youth, my page;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I'll be thy master: walk with me; speak freely.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: CYMBELINE and IMOGEN converse apart

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Is not this boy revived from death?

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: One sand another

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Not more resembles that sweet rosy lad

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Who died, and was Fidele. What think you?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: The same dead thing alive.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Peace, peace! see further; he eyes us not; forbear;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Creatures may be alike: were 't he, I am sure

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: He would have spoke to us.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: But we saw him dead.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Be silent; let's see further.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: [Aside] It is my mistress:

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Since she is living, let the time run on

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: To good or bad.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: CYMBELINE and IMOGEN come forward

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Come, stand thou by our side;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Make thy demand aloud.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To IACHIMO

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Sir, step you forth;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Give answer to this boy, and do it freely;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Or, by our greatness and the grace of it,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Which is our honour, bitter torture shall

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Winnow the truth from falsehood. On, speak to him.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: My boon is, that this gentleman may render

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Of whom he had this ring.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: [Aside]                 What's that to him?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That diamond upon your finger, say

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: How came it yours?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Thou'lt torture me to leave unspoken that

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which, to be spoke, would torture thee.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: How! me?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I am glad to be constrain'd to utter that

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which torments me to conceal. By villany

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I got this ring: 'twas Leonatus' jewel;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Whom thou didst banish; and--which more may

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: grieve thee,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As it doth me--a nobler sir ne'er lived

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: 'Twixt sky and ground. Wilt thou hear more, my lord?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: All that belongs to this.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That paragon, thy daughter,--

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: For whom my heart drops blood, and my false spirits

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Quail to remember--Give me leave; I faint.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: My daughter! what of her? Renew thy strength:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I had rather thou shouldst live while nature will

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Than die ere I hear more: strive, man, and speak.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Upon a time,--unhappy was the clock

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That struck the hour!--it was in Rome,--accursed

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The mansion where!--'twas at a feast,--O, would

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Our viands had been poison'd, or at least

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Those which I heaved to head!--the good Posthumus--

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: What should I say? he was too good to be

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Where ill men were; and was the best of all

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Amongst the rarest of good ones,--sitting sadly,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Hearing us praise our loves of Italy

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: For beauty that made barren the swell'd boast

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Of him that best could speak, for feature, laming

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The shrine of Venus, or straight-pight Minerva.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Postures beyond brief nature, for condition,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: A shop of all the qualities that man

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Loves woman for, besides that hook of wiving,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Fairness which strikes the eye--

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I stand on fire:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Come to the matter.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: All too soon I shall,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Unless thou wouldst grieve quickly. This Posthumus,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Most like a noble lord in love and one

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That had a royal lover, took his hint;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And, not dispraising whom we praised,--therein

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: He was as calm as virtue--he began

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: His mistress' picture; which by his tongue

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: being made,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And then a mind put in't, either our brags

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Were crack'd of kitchen-trolls, or his description

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Proved us unspeaking sots.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Nay, nay, to the purpose.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Your daughter's chastity--there it begins.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: He spake of her, as Dian had hot dreams,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And she alone were cold: whereat I, wretch,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Made scruple of his praise; and wager'd with him

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Pieces of gold 'gainst this which then he wore

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Upon his honour'd finger, to attain

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: In suit the place of's bed and win this ring

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: By hers and mine adultery. He, true knight,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: No lesser of her honour confident

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Than I did truly find her, stakes this ring;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And would so, had it been a carbuncle

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Of Phoebus' wheel, and might so safely, had it

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Been all the worth of's car. Away to Britain

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Post I in this design: well may you, sir,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Remember me at court; where I was taught

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Of your chaste daughter the wide difference

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: 'Twixt amorous and villanous. Being thus quench'd

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Of hope, not longing, mine Italian brain

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: 'Gan in your duller Britain operate

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Most vilely; for my vantage, excellent:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And, to be brief, my practise so prevail'd,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That I return'd with simular proof enough

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To make the noble Leonatus mad,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: By wounding his belief in her renown

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: With tokens thus, and thus; averting notes

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Of chamber-hanging, pictures, this her bracelet,--

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: O cunning, how I got it!--nay, some marks

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Of secret on her person, that he could not

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: But think her bond of chastity quite crack'd,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I having ta'en the forfeit. Whereupon--

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Methinks, I see him now--

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: [Advancing]             Ay, so thou dost,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Italian fiend! Ay me, most credulous fool,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Egregious murderer, thief, any thing

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: That's due to all the villains past, in being,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: To come! O, give me cord, or knife, or poison,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Some upright justicer! Thou, king, send out

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: For torturers ingenious: it is I

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: That all the abhorred things o' the earth amend

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: By being worse than they. I am Posthumus,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: That kill'd thy daughter:--villain-like, I lie--

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: That caused a lesser villain than myself,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: A sacrilegious thief, to do't: the temple

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Of virtue was she; yea, and she herself.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Spit, and throw stone s, cast mire upon me, set

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The dogs o' the street to bay me: every villain

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Be call'd Posthumus Leonitus; and

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Be villany less than 'twas! O Imogen!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: My queen, my life, my wife! O Imogen,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Imogen, Imogen!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Peace, my lord; hear, hear--

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Shall's have a play of this? Thou scornful page,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: There lie thy part.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Striking her: she falls

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: O, gentlemen, help!

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Mine and your mistress! O, my lord Posthumus!

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: You ne'er kill'd Imogen til now. Help, help!

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Mine honour'd lady!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Does the world go round?

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: How come these staggers on me?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Wake, my mistress!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: If this be so, the gods do mean to strike me

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To death with mortal joy.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: How fares thy mistress?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: O, get thee from my sight;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thou gavest me poison: dangerous fellow, hence!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Breathe not where princes are.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The tune of Imogen!

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Lady,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: The gods throw stones of sulphur on me, if

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: That box I gave you was not thought by me

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: A precious thing: I had it from the queen.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: New matter still?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: It poison'd me.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: O gods!

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: I left out one thing which the queen confess'd.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Which must approve thee honest: 'If Pisanio

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Have,' said she, 'given his mistress that confection

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Which I gave him for cordial, she is served

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: As I would serve a rat.'

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: What's this, Comelius?

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: The queen, sir, very oft importuned me

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: To temper poisons for her, still pretending

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: The satisfaction of her knowledge only

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: In killing creatures vile, as cats and dogs,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Of no esteem: I, dreading that her purpose

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Was of more danger, did compound for her

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: A certain stuff, which, being ta'en, would cease

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: The present power of life, but in short time

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: All offices of nature should again

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Do their due functions. Have you ta'en of it?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Most like I did, for I was dead.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: My boys,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: There was our error.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: This is, sure, Fidele.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Why did you throw your wedded lady from you?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Think that you are upon a rock; and now

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Throw me again.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Embracing him

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Hang there like a fruit, my soul,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Till the tree die!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: How now, my flesh, my child!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: What, makest thou me a dullard in this act?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Wilt thou not speak to me?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: [Kneeling]               Your blessing, sir.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: [To GUIDERIUS and ARVIRAGUS]  Though you did love

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: this youth, I blame ye not:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: You had a motive for't.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: My tears that fall

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Prove holy water on thee! Imogen,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thy mother's dead.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I am sorry for't, my lord.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: O, she was nought; and long of her it was

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That we meet here so strangely: but her son

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Is gone, we know not how nor where.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: My lord,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Now fear is from me, I'll speak troth. Lord Cloten,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Upon my lady's missing, came to me

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: With his sword drawn; foam'd at the mouth, and swore,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: If I discover'd not which way she was gone,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: It was my instant death. By accident,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: had a feigned letter of my master's

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Then in my pocket; which directed him

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: To seek her on the mountains near to Milford;

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Where, in a frenzy, in my master's garments,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Which he enforced from me, away he posts

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: With unchaste purpose and with oath to violate

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: My lady's honour: what became of him

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I further know not.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Let me end the story:

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I slew him there.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Marry, the gods forfend!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I would not thy good deeds should from my lips

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Pluck a bard sentence: prithee, valiant youth,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Deny't again.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I have spoke it, and I did it.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: He was a prince.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: A most incivil one: the wrongs he did me

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Were nothing prince-like; for he did provoke me

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: With language that would make me spurn the sea,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: If it could so roar to me: I cut off's head;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And am right glad he is not standing here

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: To tell this tale of mine.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I am sorry for thee:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: By thine own tongue thou art condemn'd, and must

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Endure our law: thou'rt dead.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That headless man

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I thought had been my lord.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Bind the offender,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And take him from our presence.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Stay, sir king:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: This man is better than the man he slew,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: As well descended as thyself; and hath

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: More of thee merited than a band of Clotens

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Had ever scar for.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To the Guard

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Let his arms alone;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: They were not born for bondage.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Why, old soldier,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Wilt thou undo the worth thou art unpaid for,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: By tasting of our wrath? How of descent

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: As good as we?

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: In that he spake too far.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And thou shalt die for't.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: We will die all three:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: But I will prove that two on's are as good

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: As I have given out him. My sons, I must,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: For mine own part, unfold a dangerous speech,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Though, haply, well for you.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Your danger's ours.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And our good his.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Have at it then, by leave.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Thou hadst, great king, a subject who

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Was call'd Belarius.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: What of him? he is

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A banish'd traitor.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: He it is that hath

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Assumed this age; indeed a banish'd man;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I know not how a traitor.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Take him hence:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The whole world shall not save him.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Not too hot:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: First pay me for the nursing of thy sons;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And let it be confiscate all, so soon

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: As I have received it.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Nursing of my sons!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I am too blunt and saucy: here's my knee:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Ere I arise, I will prefer my sons;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Then spare not the old father. Mighty sir,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: These two young gentlemen, that call me father

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And think they are my sons, are none of mine;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: They are the issue of your loins, my liege,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And blood of your begetting.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: How! my issue!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: So sure as you your father's. I, old Morgan,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Am that Belarius whom you sometime banish'd:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Your pleasure was my mere offence, my punishment

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Itself, and all my treason; that I suffer'd

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Was all the harm I did. These gentle princes--

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: For such and so they are--these twenty years

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Have I train'd up: those arts they have as I

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Could put into them; my breeding was, sir, as

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Your highness knows. Their nurse, Euriphile,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Whom for the theft I wedded, stole these children

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Upon my banishment: I moved her to't,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Having received the punishment before,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: For that which I did then: beaten for loyalty

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Excited me to treason: their dear loss,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: The more of you 'twas felt, the more it shaped

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Unto my end of stealing them. But, gracious sir,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Here are your sons again; and I must lose

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Two of the sweet'st companions in the world.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: The benediction of these covering heavens

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Fall on their heads like dew! for they are worthy

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To inlay heaven with stars.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou weep'st, and speak'st.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The service that you three have done is more

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Unlike than this thou tell'st. I lost my children:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: If these be they, I know not how to wish

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A pair of worthier sons.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Be pleased awhile.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: This gentleman, whom I call Polydore,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Most worthy prince, as yours, is true Guiderius:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: This gentleman, my Cadwal, Arviragus,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Your younger princely son; he, sir, was lapp'd

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: In a most curious mantle, wrought by the hand

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Of his queen mother, which for more probation

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I can with ease produce.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Guiderius had

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Upon his neck a mole, a sanguine star;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: It was a mark of wonder.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: This is he;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Who hath upon him still that natural stamp:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: It was wise nature's end in the donation,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To be his evidence now.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: O, what, am I

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A mother to the birth of three? Ne'er mother

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Rejoiced deliverance more. Blest pray you be,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That, after this strange starting from your orbs,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: may reign in them now! O Imogen,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou hast lost by this a kingdom.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: No, my lord;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I have got two worlds by 't. O my gentle brothers,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Have we thus met? O, never say hereafter

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But I am truest speaker you call'd me brother,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: When I was but your sister; I you brothers,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: When ye were so indeed.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Did you e'er meet?

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And at first meeting loved;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Continued so, until we thought he died.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: By the queen's dram she swallow'd.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: O rare instinct!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: When shall I hear all through? This fierce

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: abridgement

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Hath to it circumstantial branches, which

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Distinction should be rich in. Where? how lived You?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And when came you to serve our Roman captive?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: How parted with your brothers? how first met them?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Why fled you from the court? and whither? These,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And your three motives to the battle, with

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I know not how much more, should be demanded;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And all the other by-dependencies,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: From chance to chance: but nor the time nor place

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Will serve our long inter'gatories. See,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Posthumus anchors upon Imogen,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And she, like harmless lightning, throws her eye

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: On him, her brother, me, her master, hitting

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Each object with a joy: the counterchange

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Is severally in all. Let's quit this ground,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And smoke the temple with our sacrifices.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To BELARIUS

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou art my brother; so we'll hold thee ever.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You are my father too, and did relieve me,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To see this gracious season.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: All o'erjoy'd,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Save these in bonds: let them be joyful too,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: For they shall taste our comfort.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: My good master,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I will yet do you service.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Happy be you!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The forlorn soldier, that so nobly fought,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: He would have well becomed this place, and graced

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The thankings of a king.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I am, sir,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The soldier that did company these three

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: In poor beseeming; 'twas a fitment for

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The purpose I then follow'd. That I was he,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Speak, Iachimo: I had you down and might

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Have made you finish.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: [Kneeling]          I am down again:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: But now my heavy conscience sinks my knee,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As then your force did. Take that life, beseech you,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which I so often owe: but your ring first;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And here the bracelet of the truest princess

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That ever swore her faith.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Kneel not to me:

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The power that I have on you is, to spare you;

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The malice towards you to forgive you: live,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: And deal with others better.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Nobly doom'd!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: We'll learn our freeness of a son-in-law;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Pardon's the word to all.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: You holp us, sir,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: As you did mean indeed to be our brother;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Joy'd are we that you are.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Your servant, princes. Good my lord of Rome,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Call forth your soothsayer: as I slept, methought

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Great Jupiter, upon his eagle back'd,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Appear'd to me, with other spritely shows

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Of mine own kindred: when I waked, I found

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: This label on my bosom; whose containing

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Is so from sense in hardness, that I can

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Make no collection of it: let him show

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: His skill in the construction.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Philarmonus!

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Here, my good lord.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Read, and declare the meaning.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: [Reads]  'When as a lion's whelp shall, to himself

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: unknown, without seeking find, and be embraced by a

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: piece of tender air; and when from a stately cedar

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: shall be lopped branches, which, being dead many

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: years, shall after revive, be jointed to the old

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: stock, and freshly grow; then shall Posthumus end

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: his miseries, Britain be fortunate and flourish in

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: peace and plenty.'

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Thou, Leonatus, art the lion's whelp;

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: The fit and apt construction of thy name,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Being Leonatus, doth import so much.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: To CYMBELINE

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: The piece of tender air, thy virtuous daughter,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Which we call 'mollis aer;' and 'mollis aer'

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: We term it 'mulier:' which 'mulier' I divine

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Is this most constant wife; who, even now,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Answering the letter of the oracle,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Unknown to you, unsought, were clipp'd about

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: With this most tender air.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: This hath some seeming.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: The lofty cedar, royal Cymbeline,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Personates thee: and thy lopp'd branches point

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Thy two sons forth; who, by Belarius stol'n,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: For many years thought dead, are now revived,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: To the majestic cedar join'd, whose issue

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Promises Britain peace and plenty.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Well

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: My peace we will begin. And, Caius Lucius,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Although the victor, we submit to Caesar,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And to the Roman empire; promising

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To pay our wonted tribute, from the which

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: We were dissuaded by our wicked queen;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Whom heavens, in justice, both on her and hers,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Have laid most heavy hand.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: The fingers of the powers above do tune

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: The harmony of this peace. The vision

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Which I made known to Lucius, ere the stroke

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Of this yet scarce-cold battle, at this instant

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Is full accomplish'd; for the Roman eagle,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: From south to west on wing soaring aloft,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Lessen'd herself, and in the beams o' the sun

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: So vanish'd: which foreshow'd our princely eagle,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: The imperial Caesar, should again unite

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: His favour with the radiant Cymbeline,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Which shines here in the west.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Laud we the gods;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And let our crooked smokes climb to their nostrils

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: From our blest altars. Publish we this peace

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To all our subjects. Set we forward: let

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A Roman and a British ensign wave

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Friendly together: so through Lud's-town march:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And in the temple of great Jupiter

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Our peace we'll ratify; seal it with feasts.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Set on there! Never was a war did cease,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Ere bloody hands were wash'd, with such a peace.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Exeunt
